header: Cri. Bail Appl. No. 141/2019 ( CNR NO.MHPU01­000593­2019 ) Harshal Gavade & Ors. Vs. State of Maharashtra ORDER BELOW EXH. 4

background.text: 1] This is an application for grant of Ad­interim Anticipatory Bail under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No.4/2019 registered under Sections 498(A), 323, 504, 506 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Haveli, Dist. Pune.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of the code of criminal procedure
under sections 498(a), 323, 504, 506 read with section 34 of indian penal code

arguments.text: 2] Informant Pallavi Harshal Gavade is wife of Applicant No. 1, Applicant No. 2 and 3 are her in­laws. The marriage had taken place on 18/12/2016. She alleged that, Applicant No.1 used to consume liquor and used to abuse and ill­treat her. Applicant No. 2 and 3 also used to abuse and threaten her and keep her on starvation. Therefore, she lodged the report.

argumentSentences.text: 2] Informant Pallavi Harshal Gavade is wife of Applicant No. 1, Applicant No. 2 and 3 are her in­laws.
The marriage had taken place on 18/12/2016.
She alleged that, Applicant No.1 used to consume liquor and used to abuse and ill­treat her.
Applicant No. 2 and 3 also used to abuse and threaten her and keep her on starvation.

arguments.text: 3] Applicants submit that, totally false offence has been registered against them. In fact, Applicant No. 1 has moved one petition under Section 9 of Hindu Marriage Act for restitution of conjugal rights. Therefore, Informant has filed the present FIR. All allegations are vague and general in nature. They are not going to flee away from course of justice. Hence, they pray for grant of interim protection.

argumentSentences.text: 3] Applicants submit that, totally false offence has been registered against them.
In fact, Applicant No. 1 has moved one petition under Section 9 of Hindu Marriage Act for restitution of conjugal rights.
Therefore, Informant has filed the present FIR.
All allegations are vague and general in nature.
They are not going to flee away from course of justice.
Hence, they pray for grant of interim protection.

arguments.text: 4] Heard learned Adv. Nimkar for Applicants. Perused the FIR and Papers.

argumentSentences.text: 4] Heard learned Adv. Nimkar for Applicants.

arguments.text: 5] Prima facie, allegations are about ill­treatment to Informant during the period i.e. 18/12/2016 to 20/11/2018. FIR came to be lodged on 05/01/2019. Considering the allegations, no immediate recovery is pending, therefore, immediate custody of the Applicants is not necessary. As such, I prefer to pass following Order.

argumentSentences.text: 5] Prima facie, allegations are about ill­treatment to Informant during the period i.e. 18/12/2016 to 20/11/2018.
FIR came to be lodged on 05/01/2019.
Considering the allegations, no immediate recovery is pending, therefore, immediate custody of the Applicants is not necessary.
As such, I prefer to pass following Order.

order.text: ORDER 1] Application is allowed. 2] Pending herein final disposal of main application, in the event of arrest in Crime No.4/2019 registered under Sections 498(A), 323, 504, 506 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Haveli, Dist. Pune, Applicants 1] Harshal Sharad Gavade, 2] Sharad Namdev Gavade, 3] Kalpana Sharad Gavde be released on bail on furnishing P.B. and S.B. of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rupees Fifteen Thousand Only) each on the following conditions : [A] Applicants shall make themselves available for interrogation by a Police Officer as and when required. [B] Applicants shall not, directly or indirectly, make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the Court or to any police officer. 3] Issue Notice to respondent state, returnable on 22/01/2019. 4] Intimate to concern Police Station.

processedText:
Cri. Bail Appl. No. 141/2019 ( CNR NO.MHPU01­000593­2019 ) Harshal Gavade & Ors. Vs. State of Maharashtra ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 
---header-ends---
1] This is an application for grant of Ad­interim Anticipatory Bail under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No.4/2019 registered under Sections 498(A), 323, 504, 506 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Haveli, Dist. Pune. 
---background-ends---
2] Informant Pallavi Harshal Gavade is wife of Applicant No. 1, Applicant No. 2 and 3 are her in­laws. The marriage had taken place on 18/12/2016. She alleged that, Applicant No.1 used to consume liquor and used to abuse and ill­treat her. Applicant No. 2 and 3 also used to abuse and threaten her and keep her on starvation. Therefore, she lodged the report. 
---argument-ends---
3] Applicants submit that, totally false offence has been registered against them. In fact, Applicant No. 1 has moved one petition under Section 9 of Hindu Marriage Act for restitution of conjugal rights. Therefore, Informant has filed the present FIR. All allegations are vague and general in nature. They are not going to flee away from course of justice. Hence, they pray for grant of interim protection. 
---argument-ends---
4] Heard learned Adv. Nimkar for Applicants. Perused the FIR and Papers. 
---argument-ends---
5] Prima facie, allegations are about ill­treatment to Informant during the period i.e. 18/12/2016 to 20/11/2018. FIR came to be lodged on 05/01/2019. Considering the allegations, no immediate recovery is pending, therefore, immediate custody of the Applicants is not necessary. As such, I prefer to pass following Order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] Application is allowed. 2] Pending herein final disposal of main application, in the event of arrest in Crime No.4/2019 registered under Sections 498(A), 323, 504, 506 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Haveli, Dist. Pune, Applicants 1] Harshal Sharad Gavade, 2] Sharad Namdev Gavade, 3] Kalpana Sharad Gavde be released on bail on furnishing P.B. and S.B. of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rupees Fifteen Thousand Only) each on the following conditions : [A] Applicants shall make themselves available for interrogation by a Police Officer as and when required. [B] Applicants shall not, directly or indirectly, make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the Court or to any police officer. 3] Issue Notice to respondent state, returnable on 22/01/2019. 4] Intimate to concern Police Station. 
---order-ends---
